info.author: Hugo Alliaume
info.description:
=====
Polls
=====

Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each question,
visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers.

Details documentation is in the "docs" directory

Quick start
-----------

1. Add "polls" to your INSTALLED_APPS seting like this::

   INSTALLED_APP = [
       ...
       'polls',
   ]

2. Include the polls URLconf in your project urls.py like this::

   url(r'^polls/$, include('polls.urls'))

3. Run `python manage.py migrate` to create the polls models.

4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ to
   create a pool (you will need the Admin app enabled)

5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to "faire le bo jeu".
info.name: django-kocal-polls
info.summary: A simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls.
info.html_description:
=====
Polls
=====

Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each question,
visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers.

Details documentation is in the "docs" directory

Quick start
-----------

1. Add "polls" to your INSTALLED_APPS seting like this::

INSTALLED_APP = [
...
'polls',
]

2. Include the polls URLconf in your project urls.py like this::

url(r'^polls/$, include('polls.urls'))

3. Run `python manage.py migrate` to create the polls models.

4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ to
create a pool (you will need the Admin app enabled)

5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to "faire le bo jeu".
